com.team41.boromi.controllers

Class BookController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team41.boromi.controllers.BookController

  • @Singleton
public class BookController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that handles requests that involves the book collection

      • addBook

        public void addBook(java.lang.String owner,
                    java.lang.String author,
                    java.lang.String ISBN,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String image,
                    BookCallback bookCallback)
        Adds Book to DB asynchronously. On Success or Failure, it will have a callback to let the ui know
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of the book
        author - author of the book
        ISBN - isbn of the book
        title - title of the book

      • addBook

        public void addBook(java.lang.String author,
                    java.lang.String ISBN,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    android.graphics.Bitmap image,
                    BookCallback bookCallback)
        Adds Book to DB asynchronously. On Success or Failure, it will have a callback to let the ui know
        Parameters:
        author - author of the book
        ISBN - isbn of the book
        title - title of the book
        image - book image
        bookCallback - callback to execute success or failure

      • addBook

        public void addBook(java.lang.String author,
                    java.lang.String ISBN,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String image,
                    BookCallback bookCallback)
        same add function as above, but this time owner is set automatically by whoever is logged in Just some polymorphism to have less UI handling logic

        Parameters:
        bookID - id of the book
        author - author of the book
        ISBN - isbn of the book
        title - title of the book
        image - image of the book
        bookCallback - callback to execute success or failure
